Its not for everyone.

Cons:
Heavy grind
RNG dependent ( gear, titles, index, etc)

Pros:
Great art
Fantastic OST
Can be played without money (but it will give you significant boost if you're willing)
Be solo or with a group

183593664.review:
TLDR: A low quality, pay to win nightmare with a shrinking player base and terrible in game economy. 
PROS:
- Cute anime-style characters and beautiful skill effects.
- Diverse cast of usable classes to choose from.
- Simple and intuitive skill system.
- Designed to encourage a strong community.
CONS:
- Can't play non-steam accounts on steam or steam accounts on the non-steam launcher.
- Expensive Lootboxes with disastrous rates.
- Endgame content is balanced toward p2w players.
- Economic relief pleas are met with frigid blaming of the problem on the players; even when everything outside of the cash shop is un-tradable (except with the use of a cash shop item to make them tradable), a p2w stat that increases your money gain rate, locking half of available stat gaining equipment and most of the useful consumables behind the cash shop, and founding the economy on a cash shop lootbox.
- The events are uninspired and poor quality and often include recycling events like cash shop bonuses and event currency dropping in end game dungeons with ordinary rewards in the event shop.
- The playerbase is tiny and continues to shrink, with many players admitting to their dissatisfaction for the game, but only staying for community or nostalgia.
